thread.title: 18 Movie Stars Who Made the Move to TV: Demi Moore, Meg Ryan, & More
thread.title_full: 18 Movie Stars Who Made the Move to TV: Demi Moore, Meg Ryan, & More

author: Ariana Romero
title: 18 Movie Stars Who Made the Move to TV: Demi Moore, Meg Ryan, & More
text:
Alec Baldwin Advertisement 
Per Page Six , this 30 Rock vet and current SNL guest star will be back on TV full-time in a small-screen adaptation of the book Crooked Brooklyn . He'll play a real-life figure: "hard-charging" prosecutor Michael Vecchione, a "top deputy of former Brooklyn District Attorney Charles J. Hynes." Julia Roberts Julia Roberts Advertisement 
Julia and her gorgeous smile have joined the adaptation of Maria Semple's humor novel Today Will Be Different . The limited series doesn’t have a network to call home yet, but we bet everyone from HBO to Netflix will be fighting over it. Jude Law Jude Law Advertisement 
If you currently own a TV, go outside, or watch YouTube videos, you know Jude Law is starring in The Young Pope , premiering Sunday, January 15 on HBO. The handsome Brit’s Pope Lenny Belardo isn’t a regular pope, he’s a cool pope. Nicole Kidman Nicole Kidman Advertisement 
Even three-time Oscar-nominee Nicole has gotten the TV bug. She’ll star in another new HBO series next year, Big Little Lies, which debuts Sunday, February 16. The gorgeous Aussie isn’t the only one lending her star power to BLL as fellow Academy Awards favorites Reese Witherspoon and Shailene Woodley also star. Daniel Craig Daniel Craig Advertisement 
No, you won’t see 007 on HBO, too. James Bond’s alter ego is heading to competitor Showtime with psychological thriller Purity , an adaptation of a Jonathan Franzen novel. The series doesn’t have a premiere date yet, but it does have a 20-episode order, which will play out over two seasons. Purity begins filming in 2017. Tom Hardy Advertisement 
The hunky Brit is the latest “dangerous man” on television with FX’s Taboo . The series 1814-set drama follows James Keziah Delaney, the son of a shipping tycoon who returns to London after a journey to Africa that was so long everyone assumed he was dead. Taboo premieres Tuesday, January 10. The Rock The Rock Advertisement 
Dwayne “The Rock” Johnson is the second busiest guy in Hollywood — pal Kevin Hart is the first — and he’s still manage to find time to lead HBO drama Ballers . How very baller, indeed.
